intro: Chloraea inconspicua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chloraea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its subtle appearance, it is sometimes overlooked despite its ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
